item.title: The (Economic, Rhetorical, And Physical) Beatings Will Continue Until The Presidential Approval Rating Improves!
item.description: There is no shortage of physical beatings rained down by agents of this administration, spurred by Trump's personal directives.

item.title: Opening Bell: 12.4.25
item.description: Wall Street wants its hooks in newborns, doesn’t want Hassett; layoffs leap; the asset of fear; and more!

item.title: Higher Drug Prices, No Tariffs: U.K. Trade Pact Shows How Trump Is Coaxing Countries to Pay More for Meds
item.description: The new trade agreement’s parameters could shape deals the Trump administration is pursuing with other countries.

item.title: State Makes Failed Attempt To Protect Workers Since Trump’s NLRB Won’t
item.description: The Supremacy Clause still prevents states from passing their own labor laws. Even if the federal government stops caring.

item.title: Eight Trends Employers Should Watch in 2026, Per Business Group on Health
item.description: Rising healthcare costs will be a major challenge in 2026, prompting employers to adopt innovative strategies to manage expenses.
